raw_text:
Parmar ruled out of Davis Cup tie
 
 A knee injury has forced Arvind Parmar out of Great Britain's Davis Cup tie in Israel and left Alex Bogdanovic in line to take the second singles place.
 
 Parmar picked up the injury last week and has failed to recover in time for the Europe/Africa Zone I tie, which begins in Tel Aviv on Friday. Bogdanovic looks set to take the second singles place alongside Greg Rusedski. GB captain Jeremy Bates could use 17-year-old Andrew Murray and David Sherwood in the doubles rubber. Bogdanovic and Murray both pulled out of tournaments last week through injury but are expected to be fit. Jamie Delgado and Lee Childs have been called into the squad in Tel Aviv as designated hitters for team practice but Bates has no plans to call either of them into his squad at present.
 
 The unheralded Sherwood was the surprise inclusion when the squad was announced last week, and Bates said: "David has earned his place in this squad on the merit of his form and results over the last 12 months." The 6ft 4in Sherwood is ranked 264th in the world and the LTA have high hopes for him after Futures tournament wins in Wrexham and Edinburgh.
 
 The Sheffield-born right-hander, aged 24, also reached another final in Plaisir, France, a week after making the semi-final in Mulhouse. Bates is glad to have Rusedski available after Tim Henman's retirement from Davis Cup tennis. "His wealth of experience is invaluable, particularly to the younger players and I know he will lead by example," Bates said. "We are looking forward to the tie. The squad are all in excellent form."
llama3.2:1b: Arvind Parmar has ruled out of Great Britain's Davis Cup tie in Israel due to a knee injury, leaving Alex Bogdanovic as the top singles player. Bogdanovic is expected to play alongside Greg Rusedski. Andrew Murray and David Sherwood are also part of the team. Jamie Delgado and Lee Childs have been called into practice as designated hitters for England's Davis Cup tie.
llama3.2:3b: Arvind Parmar has been ruled out of the Great Britain Davis Cup tie due to a knee injury. Alex Bogdanovic is set to take his place alongside Greg Rusedski in second singles. David Sherwood, 24, who was unexpectedly included in the squad, is expected to play doubles with Andrew Murray alongside Jeremy Bates' call-up from practice players Jamie Delgado and Lee Childs.

David Sherwood, ranked 264th, has been called up as a surprise inclusion for doubles. Jamie Delgado and Lee Childs have been brought in as designated hitters for practice but not the actual squad. The GB team will face Israel and their captain is confident.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Arvind Parmar, 24, has been ruled out of Britain's Davis Cup tie due to a knee injury that affected his recovery time. Jamie Delgado and Lee Childs were among those expected to play doubles against David Sherwood, who was called into the team practice squad in Tel Aviv. The United States team captain Jeremy Bates is looking forward to the Davis Cup tour but has no plans to call either of them into the team at present.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Arvind Parmar ruled out of Davis Cup tie due to knee injury; Alex Bogdanovic chosen as second singles player for Great Britain's tie against Israel. Jeremy Bates plans to include Andrew Murray and David Sherwood in doubles rubber, while Jamie Delgado and Lee Childs are designated hitters for practice. David Sherwood is expected to be fit following two-week absence from tournaments and has earned a place on the squad based on his recent results.
qwen2.5:3b: Arvind Parmar has been ruled out due to a knee injury, leaving Alex Bogdanovic as the sole singles player for Great Britain's Davis Cup match against Israel. Other players like 17-year-old Andrew Murray and David Sherwood could potentially play doubles. Jeremy Bates emphasizes Rusedski’s experience will be valuable for younger players. Sherwood, an under-the-radar inclusion from Sheffield, has shown recent form in Futures tournaments. Bates is pleased to have Tim Henman available after his retirement and looks forward to the upcoming match with a strong team in excellent condition.
opencoder:1.5b:
Arvind Parmar was out of Davis Cup tie due to a knee injury last week. He left Alex Bogdanovic for Europe/Africa Zone I starting Friday and is expected to recover there.

Bogdanovic struggled through injury, but he recovered and picked up the injury, leaving Parmar at the line. Greg Rusedski played in the European Championship against Tel Aviv on Friday, and Jeremy Bates was set to make it again. Andrew Murray and David Sherwood were also included from a surprise announcement last week.

Sherwood is ranked 264th in the world and is a six-foot eight inches tall選手, but he scored fewer points in a tournament compared to his age. Bates said: "His form and results over the past twelve months have proven to be impressive." He was also able to finish three games without injury during team practice, including his placement with Lee Childs.

The players who were part of the practice are Jamie Delgado and Lee Childs from France, but Bates has not called either player into their squad. However, they are expected to participate in more friendly matches for a while after the tie.

tinydolphin:1.1b: Parmar ruled out of Davis Cup tie due to knee injury; Bogdanovic takes second singles place in Great Britain. The injury sustained by Parmar last week will keep him out for at least a few weeks, leaving Alex Bogdanovic in line to take the second singles spot. Meanwhile, young guns Andrew Murray and David Sherwood are considering entering the doubles rubber for the Great Britain team as well. Jeremy Bates has no plans to call either player into the squad yet, opting instead to use established hitters such as Jamie Delgado and Lee Childs in practice for the upcoming tournament.
